name: disyllable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a word with two syllables: The word "blessed" can be pronounced as a monosyllable or a disyllable.
More examplesFewer examplesThe rapid pitch change in monosyllables is especially dramatic when a monosyllabic word with a short vowel like "bit" is compared to a disyllable with a long stressed vowel like "rival".The decision to include disyllables as well as monosyllables is motivated primarily because disyllables are strongly represented in the database.A more detailed analysis of the words produced by the Finnish children revealed that as much as 96 percent of the disyllabic words were produced as disyllables, whereas 58 percent of the words with three syllables were reduced to disyllabic productions.The calls of the birds are high-pitched and rather musical, "kee-kwa", "kik-wit", "ti-che" and similar disyllables.
